column1: Image:Romen.gifRómen is also the name in Quenya of the twenty-fifth letter of the Tengwar alphabet. In all modes this letter represents "full" trilled R
column2: unlike Óre which is used for "weak" untrilled R.
column4: The additional letters Rómen was one of the most widely known and used of all the Tengwar since it indicated "east" even in languages that used a very different term. The Westron name for this letter is Aro.See Westron Tengwar

column1: ==Etymology== The word derives from the Primitive Quendian Sundocarme RO+MEN.
